meanings.definition: In a manner related to a phrase.
meanings.sent1: She spoke phrasally, carefully choosing her words to form complete thoughts.
meanings.sent2: He writes phrasally, ensuring each sentence flows smoothly into the next.
meanings.sent3: The teacher explained the concept phrasally, making sure each idea was expressed clearly.
meanings.sent4: The music played phrasally, with each note forming part of a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The dancer moved phrasally, gracefully transitioning from one pose to another.

meanings.sent1: The book was filled with phrasally rich language, making it a joy to read.
meanings.sent2: She had a phrasally diverse vocabulary, allowing her to express herself eloquently.
meanings.sent3: The speech was phrasally captivating, engaging the audience with its well-crafted sentences.
meanings.sent4: His writing style was phrasally colorful, painting vivid pictures with words.
meanings.sent5: The song lyrics were phrasally poetic, evoking deep emotions in the listeners.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characteristic of a phrase.
meanings.sent1: The phrasally structure of the sentence made it easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: Her phrasally approach to writing helped convey her message effectively.
meanings.sent3: The phrasally nature of the conversation made it flow naturally.
meanings.sent4: The phrasally elements of the story added depth to its meaning.
meanings.sent5: His phrasally style of speaking made his points clear and concise.
